desc: All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt.
author: Charles M. Schulz

desc: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

desc: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

desc: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde

desc: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

desc: Pull up a chair. Take a taste. Come join us. Life is so endlessly delicious
author: Ruth Reichl

desc: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

desc: Probably one of the most private things in the world is an egg before it is broken.
author: M.F.K. Fisher

desc: Anything is good if it's made of chocolate.
author: Jo Brand

desc: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
author: Abraham Lincoln
